page.title: 17Woodham Ferrers Conservation
page.content: The farming land in Woodham Ferrers is divided up between five farms. The change since the second world war has been from dairy farming to arable and now few cattle are left. The main crops grown are wheat, rape, beans, peas for canning. The appearance of the countryside has changed. Hedges have been removed in large numbers and fields have been integrated. Much natural cover has been removed so that nesting sites for small birds have been drastically reduced. The road verges are sprayed so wild flowers are very scarce. Conservation groups are active and are trying to make the community aware of the problems facing the countryside. Many ponds have been filled in by farmers. There have been many campaigns aimed at the general public such as plant a tree year, build a pond year & nature programmes.
